title:
Solutions for a class of fifth-order nonlinear partial differential
  system

title_detail.value:
Solutions for a class of fifth-order nonlinear partial differential
  system

summary:
In this paper we use the generalized tanh method to obtain exact solutions
for a class of fifth-order nonlinear systems. A particular case is give by the
integrable Mikhailov--Novikov--Wang system (MNW). Periodic and soliton
solutions are formally derived. The mathematica is used.

summary_detail.value:
In this paper we use the generalized tanh method to obtain exact solutions
for a class of fifth-order nonlinear systems. A particular case is give by the
integrable Mikhailov--Novikov--Wang system (MNW). Periodic and soliton
solutions are formally derived. The mathematica is used.

author: Cesar A. Gomez S.
fulltext:
Solutions for a class of fifth-order nonlinear partial
differential system∗

arXiv:0810.1022v1 [nlin.SI] 6 Oct 2008

Cesar A Gomez S.

†

06 Oct. 2008

Abstract
In this paper we use the generalized tanh method to obtain exact solutions
for a class of fifth-order nonlinear systems. A particular case is given by the integrable Mikhailov-Novikov-Wang system (MNW). Periodic and solitons solutions
are formally derived . The Mathematica is used.

1

Introduction

The class of fifth-order systems that we consider reads
(
ut + ρuxxxxx + γuuxxx + βux uxx + αu2 ux − wx = 0
wt + 6wuxxx + 2uxxwx − 96wuux − 16wx u2 = 0,

(1)

where α, β, γ and ρ are arbitrary nonzero and real parameters, and u = u(x, t),
w = w(x, t) are differentiable functions. Lost of forms of (1) can be constructed by
changing the values of parameters. In the particular case α = −80, β = 50, γ = 20,
ρ = −1, (1) reduces to the new Mikhailov-Novikov-Wang system [1][2][3][4][5] (MVW)
(
ut = uxxxxx − 20uuxxx − 50ux uxx + 80u2 ux + wx
(2)
wt = −6wuxxx − 2uxx wx + 96wuux + 16wx u2 ,
which was derived by the authors in [2] using the symmetry approach. We refer to [2]
for more details about this system . In the case that w(x, t) = 0 and ρ = 1, the system
(1) reduces to fifth-order KdV equation [6][7][8][9][10]
ut + uxxxxx + γuuxxx + βux uxx + αu2 ux = 0.

(3)

This equation has been recently studied in [7][8][9][10]. Some important particular
cases of (3) are given by Lax, Sawada–Kotera, Kaup–Kupershdmit, and Ito equations
[7][8][9][10].
∗ 2000

Mathematics Subject Classification: 35C05.
of Mathematics, Universidad Nacional de Colombia, Bogotá, Colombia e-mail :
cagomezsi@unal.edu.co
† Department

1

 The searching of exact solutions of nonlinear partial differential equations is the
great importance for many researches. A variety of powerful methods such that
tanh method and generalized tanh method [6][7][11][12],
general projective Riccati equations method[13][14] [15] and other methods (see for instance [7][8][9][10][16][17]) have been developed in this direction. In this work, we will
use the generalized tanh method [8][11][12] to construct periodic and solitons solutions
to (1). This paper is organized as follows: In Sec. 1, we will be reviewed briefly
of the generalized tanh method. In Sec. 2, we give the mathematical framework to
search exact solutions to (1). In sec. 3, we obtain exact solutions to (1). Finally some
conclusions are given.

2

The generalized tanh method

The generalized tanh method can be summarized as follows. For a given nonlinear
equation that does not explicitly involve independent variables
P (u, ux , ut , uxx , uxt , utt , . . .) = 0,

(4)

we use the wave transformation
u(x, t) = v(ξ),

ξ = x + λt,

(5)

where λ is a constant.
Under the transformation (5), (4) reduces to ODE in the function v(ξ)
P (v, v ′ , v ′′ , . . .) = 0.

(6)

The next crucial step is to introduce a new variable φ(ξ) which is a solution of the
Riccati equation
φ′ (ξ) = φ(ξ)2 + k,
(7)
where k is a constant.

2

and collecting all terms with the same power φ(ξ)i , we get a polynomial in the variable
φ(ξ). Equaling the coefficients of this polynomial to zero, we can obtain a system
of algebraic equations, from which the constants ai , λ (i = 1, 2, . . . , M ) are obtained
explicitly. Lastly, we found solutions for (4) in the original variables.

3

4

 4

Conclusions

In the previous sections, we have presented an analysis over a generalizations of the
MNW system. A large number of forms of the fifth-order system with exact solutions
can be constructed. Exact solutions for some particular cases such that MikhailovNovikov-Wang system can be derived. The generalized tanh method provides a straightforward algorithm to compute particular periodic and solitons solutions for a large class
of nonlinear systems.
Acknowledgments: The authors wants to express their gratitude to professor A.
Sinitsyn for his helpful suggestions and recommendations about this paper.
